amendment.description: An amendment numbered 35 printed in Part B of House Report 115-261 to specify that $25 million appropriated for Defense Health Program research, development, test and evaluation may be used to award grants to medical researchers and universities to support research into early detection of chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE).
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 35 printed in Part B of House Report 115-261 to specify that $25 million appropriated for Defense Health Program research, development, test and evaluation may be used to award grants to medical researchers and universities to support research into early detection of chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE).

vote.text: On agreeing to the Speier amendment (A052) Failed by voice vote.

action.text: House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A052) offered by Ms. Speier.
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Speier amendment (A052) Failed by voice vote.
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
